qas.question: The Republic of Cyprus does not have de jure sovereignty over what two British territories?
How many parts is the Republic of Cyprus partitioned into?
How much area of the island does the Republic control?
The Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus is only recognized by what country?
What does the international community consider the northern part of Cyprus?

answers.text: territory of the Republic of Cyprus occupied by Turkish forces

context: The Republic of Cyprus has de jure sovereignty over the island of Cyprus and its surrounding waters, according to international law, except for the British Overseas Territory of <a0_0>Akrotiri and Dhekelia<a0_0/>, administered as Sovereign Base Areas. However, the Republic of Cyprus is de facto partitioned into <a1_0>two main parts<a1_0/>; the area under the effective control of the Republic, comprising about <a2_0>59%<a2_0/> of the island's area, and the north, administered by the self-declared Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus, which is recognised only by <a3_0>Turkey<a3_0/>, covering about 36% of the island's area. The international community considers the northern part of the island as <a4_0>territory of the Republic of Cyprus occupied by Turkish forces<a4_0/>. The occupation is viewed as illegal under international law, amounting to illegal occupation of EU territory since Cyprus became a member of the European Union.
